result.name: british-crime-survey-2010-public-perceptions-policing
result.notes:
Home Office Statistical Bulletin 18/11 is the first in a series of supplementary volumes that accompany the main annual Home Office Statistical Bulletin ‘Crime in England and Wales 2010/11’.

This supplementary volume presents findings from additional analyses based on the 2010/11 BCS on people’s contact and engagement with the police, their views of how authorities in the local area are dealing with anti-social behaviour, their awareness and perceptions of Community Payback and their perceptions of crime.

odi-certificate.title: Perceptions of crime, engagement with the police, authorities dealing with anti-social behaviour and Community Payback: from the 2010/11 British Crime Survey, Supplementary Volume 1 to Crime in England and Wales 2010/11

organization.name: home-office
organization.title: Home Office
organization.description:
The Home Office leads on immigration and passports, drugs policy, crime policy and counter-terrorism and works to ensure visible, responsive and accountable policing in the UK.

Home Office is a ministerial department, supported by 26 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/home-office

result.title: Perceptions of crime, engagement with the police, authorities dealing with anti-social behaviour and Community Payback: from the 2010/11 British Crime Survey, Supplementary Volume 1 to Crime in England and Wales 2010/11
